descriptions.overview: The RK3441K compact circular saw can essentially replace a mulcher's or professionals need for a full-size 7-1/4 In. circular saw. This saw was born to cut wood, especially 2 In. final lumber materials. This saw weighs only 5 lbs, so it is easy to transport and maneuver (especially overhead). The slim, infeed grip design provides great comfort, balance, and control. The 41/2 In. blade cuts 2X4s in a single pass and is about 50% lighter than conventional 71/4 In. circular saws. Plus, the lightweight saw's left-sided blade design provides remarkable cut-line visibility. The saw's 4-1/2 In. blade has a kerf that is less than half the thickness of larger 7-1/4 In. circular saw blades. Since this smaller, thinner blade takes much less effort and motor strain to cut through the material, the 5 Amp to 3500 rpm saw can match the performance of full-size circular saws. The saw's maximum cutting depth at 90° is 1-11/16 In. and the bevel capacity at 45° is 1-1/8 In.. the saw also features a dust extraction port and a 1-1/4 In. vacuum adapter for dust collection and a clean work environment.
list: Powerful 5-amp motor delivers up to 3,500-RPM for a range of cutting applications
0°-45° Bevel capacity allows for a variety of cuts
Arbor-lock button for easy blade changes
Slim-line grip design for comfort, balance and control
Easy-set depth-gauge lever provides quick setup and cutting adjustments
Includes rip fence for increased accuracy

reviews.title: "Engineers should redesign this tool"
reviews.text:
Bought last  year to fix up my trailer. Being disabled, I thought it would be ideal for any job. Well NO. the engineers should make the grip diameter smaller. 2. the on safety switch should be on top not on the side. 3. Blades bind and kick back when I am to the end of the cut 2x4 and 1 1/2 inc wood rails even 1/4 in plywood and even in a jig. I have changed out the blade. made sure it was in correctly and even guided it with 2 hands still binds and kicks back. I do like the smallness of the tool. 
I am looking for a smaller rotter saw. Until they fix these problems I do not recommend this saw.  Not a Happy woodworker on this on.
reviews.author: LABiker777

reviews.title: "Great saw!"
reviews.text: I bought this saw from the large blue home improvement store on impulse. I have owned a circular saw for many years and have always hated it. I would use a handsaw just to keep from heaving that monster around. This little saw can do anything the large one can do and more due to its smaller size. I have made floor cut outs with it (3/4 OSB plywood), cut laminate flooring with it, I even removed some old cabinets with it sawing (unknown at the time) through the klix cabinet connectors with no problems. If my blade is dull I can't tell it. I run it one handed with no trouble. If the circular saws both you this is the saw for you.
reviews.author: review01

reviews.title: "Where has this thing been all my life?"
reviews.text: Completely Awesome. In the 2 weeks that I have had it I have cut Corian countertops with it, I have cut tons of plywood and a few 2x4's but the most amazing thing is the cooktop cutout that I did in a 3/4" thick Quartz countertop. I would probably not use it for a production saw on granite but if you have a granite cut to make from time to time this will get it done.The dust collection is very good, which is one of the most important features to me because all of the work that I do is in kitchens, in lived in homes and maintaining the mess is key.I love it and would recommend it to anyone. It's awesome.
reviews.author: Countertop Repair Shop

reviews.title: "Good for small projects."
reviews.text: Definitely not good for bigger projects. I tried to cut up multiple pieces of 4x2 plywood and it started binding after about 30 minutes. I will say it had a very even, smooth cut. I just think it is better for very short, quick cuts. Also, make sure and attach some kind of dust collection. This thing spits sawdust everywhere.
reviews.author: Jennifer

reviews.title: "Effective for its intended use and very comfortabe"
reviews.text: I bought this saw about a month ago from Lowe's and have used it on 2x4's, as well as 45 degree miter cuts on baseboard trims. It is very comfortable to hold and wotk with with good line of view of the cut. Seems very sturdy and heavy duty.While it is not a complete replacement of a full size circular saw in terms of accuracy, power, and depth of cut, it used for what it is intended for it is very effective. This saw is now my first go to saw for everyday use as most of my applications do not need cabinet building accuracy. It is small, powerful enough, and easy to pull out quickly, use and put away.
reviews.author: Flacon

reviews.title: "Handy lil tool"
reviews.text: Needed a basic saw that didn't take up a whole lot of space - mainly for some 1” and 2x4 boards. Perfect for my needs- but would probably recommend a chop saw for more accurate cuts and using for bigger projects
reviews.author: Huch

reviews.title: "Power and precision in a small package."
reviews.text: I purchased this 5 Amp mini saw a few weeks ago and immediately used it for several projects. I am very impressed with its power for such a small and easily controllable tool. It easily cuts where you point it and has the power to not stall or bind when reaching into awkward situations, which can really mess up a cut. There's no way my other, larger circular saw could be used in such a way, nor with such great effect. Just like the Sonicrafter F50 I purchased a year ago, this saw is of excellent quality and design. I'm looking forward to increasing my Rockwell tool collection as various needs arise.
reviews.author: Mugsy

reviews.title: "Get the right tool for the job."
reviews.text: I have been reading reviews on this saw and other similar type "compact" saws. Most of the negative complaints are about binding and lack of power when cutting 3/4" plywood up to 2x4 lumber. As a carpenter and home builder I would never consider a saw like this for such heavy applications. I intend to use one for 1/4" paneling and getting into tight spaces for small cuts. 4 to 7 amp saws are not made for heavy use. They may be able to work in some heavy applications but you risk burning up the motor or tweaking the frame by pushing these little saws too hard. Use the right size saw for the work.
reviews.author: Boots

reviews.title: "Compact...Lightweight"
reviews.text: Haven't used it yet, but bought it for it's compactness and light weight design. I'm always traveling to help others do projects and this fits in with the way I like to travel (no more big bulky circular saw). Was considering a cordless saw but was sold to on the Rockwell corded (this will out perform cordless any day). Also received a discount from on line purchase that the big box stores couldn't beat, ordered optional blades also so now I'm equipped to tackle any job. I have my dad's Rockwell circular saw that is about 50 years old and still preforms well, plan to have this one last as long.
reviews.author: Terrible Ted

reviews.title: "THE MIGHTY MIDGET"
reviews.text: I was tired from lugging around the standard 7 1/2" Circular saw and found it too difficult to work in tight places. When I saw the Rockwell 4 1/2" I knew I had to have it and extremely glad I did. It's light weight but weighty in power and to hold this saw you know it's going to perform. I do highly recommend this product and only found out by trial and error that it's not a good idea to push the saw through your workpiece. Move slowly and accurately and this saw will perform flawlessly. I have four Rockwell products and proud to have them in my tool arsenal and look forward to adding to it.
reviews.author: bungalowjoe

reviews.title: "Great Big Little Saw!!!!!"
reviews.text: I purchased this fantastic saw from Lowes for the purpose of cutting plywood sheets to board up an empty house to keep squaters out until we can renovate it later this summer. The saw just blew me away!!!!! It has plenty of power and with its light weight you can cut all day and never get tired. I boarded up 18 windows, 3 entry doors and a good sized hole in the kitchen wall. The Rockwell never hesitated once, never got bogged down and ran smoothly the whole time. I have since used the saw for another half dozen little projects and it has quickly become my go to saw of choice. I would recommend this saw to anyone DIYer or Contractor needing a reliable circular saw. It is absolutely a WINNER!!!
reviews.author: Ned1969

reviews.title: "Love it!!"
reviews.text: My husband bought this for me for Valentine's Day (cuz he's awesome!) and I used it for 2 3/4" plywood pieces I had glued together (1 1/2"). It zipped right through the stock with NO problem! It's smaller and much more handy then a circular saw. The only problem (if you could call it that) is the dust collection port is small, think household vacuum not shop vac. I wish there was an adapter. But it takes the dust away from your eyes so that's always good. It was very easy to use, light weight but heavy enough to be powerful, strong, well balanced, and wasn't super loud like a circular saw.
reviews.author: Alwaysbuildingsomething

reviews.title: "One of my favorite tools"
reviews.text: After reading a few reviews, I picked up one of these saws to take care of some specific saw cut needs for a bay window project. Now I rarely even get out the "regular" circular saw any more! This thing is so easy to handle and it is really pretty powerful. It's worked for plunge cuts, detail cuts, and I even cut up scrap with it. Goes through plywood exceptionally well and also adjusts deep enough for a 2x4. Best of all you can confidently use it one-handed very safely and accurately. The thin blade profile is very helpful and makes the difference on several project needs; it works for things I wouldn't have taken a chance on with a larger circular saw. I'm really just very happy with this tool.
reviews.author: Big 186

reviews.title: "Only one problem for me"
reviews.text:
I purchased this saw to do reparations to my home after my home was flooded by Hurricane Harvey. My intent was to cut out sheetrock and cut baseboard. I ended up using it also to cut a few pieces of ceramic tile. 
The saw performs very well. I like the depth adjustment feature as well as the miter setting. However, being female, my hands are smaller than the average male and I find it extremely difficult to hold the safety button and trigger at the same time. My hand and arm become very fatigued after a short time using the saw. It would be great if the handle were a little slimmer.
reviews.author: Delype

reviews.title: "Rockwell Compact Circular Saw"
reviews.text: I purchased this compact circular saw in order to do one specific project. I had a close quarters cut I needed to make under my deck in order to trim 2" off a nailer board so that I would have room to install an under the deck drainage system. I would be standing on a ladder, with both arms over my head, cutting a 10 foot board. No other saw was small enough to fit the space or cut deep enough to do the job. The cut was not easy, but I got it done with the Rockwell Compact Circular Saw. I have since used the saw for a number of other small jobs for which that it worked perfectly.
reviews.author: Skip

reviews.title: "Light weight!"
reviews.text: I love this saw! I use it for my smaller projects but it handles like my full sized circular saws. The only improvement I would recommend is to move the safety switch further up the handle, you need to depress the button with your thumb before pulling on the trigger switch underneath with your index finger and I find it a little awkward as I have to really stretch my thumb to reach the button and my hands are not small at all, if I lay my hands on a flat surface palms down and measure diagonally from the tip of my pinky to the tip of my thumb it is 10 inches long and I still have a hard time reaching the button with my thumb. Otherwise, this is a great little saw, very convenient and powerful for it's size.
reviews.author: Beenze

reviews.title: "Overall a Great Little Tool!"
reviews.text: This is a great little tool that works well.   Been cutting through boards with ease and no issues at all.  My only complaint is that I wish the "over ride" safety button was in a different location.  I understand that safety is the issue, but it is hard to push the safety and the power at the same time, so I have to use my other hand to press the button and therefore let go of the work I am holding.   Not a major issue, but a little bit of a pain.  Overall I love the product and would buy once gain.  So much easier than lugging out my Circular Saw.   Highly Recommended. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.author: HistoryOfTheYankeesDOTcom

reviews.title: "Too convenient"
reviews.text: I got this little saw because I started making chicken coops and dog houses. I was framing with 2x2s and 1x2s and using 3/8 plywood and luan. This thing was so powerful I was sing it on full 2x4s and 6s along with 1/2 and 3/4 plywood. The worm drive allowed it cut anything I put it to. Also, it's so compact it fits right in my toolbag. If I'm going on a roof or something, it fits in my nail pouch. A must have for quick easy access to a saw without taking out the full size. Honestly, I beat the heck out of it as my main saw. No signs of getting tired. I love this thing.
reviews.author: Farmer Bill

reviews.title: "Well engineered product!"
reviews.text: I got this as a gift on Father's Day. I do a lot of woodworking and constructing. I have used my Craftsman 10" power miter saw and my Craftsman hand-held 8" circular saw for years. They are now collecting dust in my garage. The engineer that designed this Rockwell 4-1/2" Compact Circular Saw should be commended! Easy to handle, easy to operate, extremely portable and has easily and neatly cut through every challenge that I have put it up to. Great power tools are hard to find today. This is the perfect power hand saw for professionals and amateurs alike. Great job!
reviews.author: JoeEng

reviews.title: "Don't waste your money!"
reviews.text: Underpowered, rattles itself apart.  Couldn't cut a straight line even with a saw guide.  Design is horrible for use.  The location of the safety switch and power button just don't work!  Who designed this thing?  Obvious someone who has never done carpenter work or any kind of projects that would require its use.  Good idea, pitifully executed.
reviews.author: Ric

reviews.title: "nice easy lightweight powerful tool"
reviews.text: glad I bought , lightweight and powerful. long cord is nice. reaching out to cut is so much easier because of the above statement. the only thing I regret is that it came without a case for us that try to keep our tools in new condition and are too organized. really wish that it had a case for storage. tool itself is great, like to keep it that way is why it needs a case, tool deserves more than being tossed into a pile with other tools. Rockwell needs to respect there products better at the customer level and give us the protection at the storage level too..
reviews.author: bill123

reviews.title: "Compact Circular Saw Winning Attributes"
reviews.text: I bought the 4-1/2" compact circular saw on line and was hoping for great features and attributes from Rockwell.  The first attributes was the blade guard ease of mounting and use when cutting; Safety first! the second was the sturdy case and ease of a ergonomic grip; Second part of safe use. The third wonderful feature is the ease of changing the blades which is essential for efficient use in the field. Lastly was the quietness compared to the other vendor's saw I had. Noise is a hazard and also a hindrance to running the saw safely with other in the area.
reviews.author: LT2GO

reviews.title: "Useful for most woodcutting jobs"
reviews.text: On my horizon I did not see a small, worm drive circular saw. A small shelving job in another state (without my tools) required a saw, so I picked up the Rockwell RK3441K. I figured it would be sufficient for that job and I was curious. It surpassed my expectations. It cut well. It was easier to make a smooth cut faster. I like the dust extractor hookup. Even without a dust extractor it lets me direct the blow of the sawdust. It is now my handheld saw of choice. I use others only when the job requires it.The only downside for me is that the blade is special to the tool; I believe one is stuck buying the Rockwell blades. This leaves one vulnerable to having to buy a whole new saw if Rockwell stops making blades with those specs.
reviews.author: George3

reviews.title: "I can't get the hang of it"
reviews.text: I've tried to like this. First I find the safety button/lever is tricky to hold and also pull the the power lever. I feel like it distracts me more than it helps because I find I keep needing to pay attention to whether or not I have it fully engaged. Secondly, I have a difficult time getting the blade to keep going without getting lugged up and stopping. Again I find myself distracted trying to get the plate flat and in place so the blade will engage and keep going. You have to physically push down on the plate at just the right angle or the blade won't move. I really don't like it. It doesn't work like a real full sized circular saw. I'm extremely disappointed in it. The multiple safety features actually make me feel unsafe using it.
reviews.author: CaliforniaCbeee

reviews.title: "Best compact saw for anything you can think of"
reviews.text: I just picked up this saw today and I have to say I am impressed. I've owned other battery operated or plug in portable handheld saws in the last that just couldn't cut it pun intended. I have been using all day to cut and lay 170sq ft of flooring and it has cut perfect every time. I have a 30 year old Rockwell table saw that still works great and I feel like this saw is just as solid as my old reliable. It feels great one handed I do agree with other reviews that the safety is kinda awkward for short fingers but you get used to how it works.
reviews.author: Brix

reviews.title: "Little Saw/Great Job"
reviews.text: I have had my saw over six months but I have used it more than I ever thought I would when I purchased it. This saw was got with the thought I would use it only on a little job or small projects. But I got hooked on this saw after the first cut. Since, I have used it in the shop and on jobs that I would never seen me doing the day I got it. It's easy to use, easy to get great cuts, being wood from pine to hardwood, being tile that is small to big size tile. Small Saw that is well worth the money and handle jobs that will surprise you.
reviews.author: txrick

reviews.title: "Hobert Monk"
reviews.text: I purchased this saw for the sole purpose of cutting cement blocks. I completed by project of trimming cement blocks to fit around the tree I had planted. The saw performed way better then I expected. I would highly recommend this saw for all the small project you have requiring a saw. I did not have to drag out my regular skill saw that larger and more awkward.
reviews.author: Hobie

reviews.title: "Handy, Durable & Cuts a 4 x 4"
reviews.text: This is my second Rockwell after thoroughly abusing my first one in the whole home renovation.  It's just so darn handy and light that I grab it every time over my skill saw or chop saw.  You can easily adjust it to cut any angle. I like to teach my teens how to handle power tools and this is an excellent introduction tool to build their confidence. This saw is great for working in confined spaces and for quick jobs where you just need to cut a board here or there.  Value for money is exceptional.  You won't regret this purchase.
reviews.author: Adie88

reviews.title: "4 1/2" Circular saw"
reviews.text: I bought it about a month ago. Seemed like a good investment. Got it home pieces were missing. Company shipped missing parts right away no problems. A little bit disappointed, I read how the blade likes to bind since the blade is so thin. I never thought it would bind and jump cutting something as simple as drywall. Man drywall looks ugly. Perhaps I need time to get to know the tool better, I have some tools that after awhile I have become a pro with them, I am hoping this will be the same. Tool might need patience.
reviews.author: Mikey2148

reviews.title: "Only one I don't like"
reviews.text: There is only one thing I don't like about this saw. I agree with the reviews that criticize the placement of the lock-off button. My hands/fingers are too small to hold the tool and push the lock-off button with the thumb I am holding the tool with. I find that I have to use my other hand to press the lock-off button and then press the start trigger with the hand I am holding the saw with. I am thinking that I shouldn't have to use two hands just to get the saw to operate. Otherwise the saw works pretty good.
reviews.author: noname

reviews.title: "Runs great but ........."
reviews.text: Bought to do some light work on church pews thinking I would get a better cut with little damage to cut area, however, cutting approx. 1 3/4 inch pew support, the saw drifts away from the cut line. After two attempts and inspecting saw for blade looseness, etc. , set the saw aside and used my ole 7 inch saw. Have new blades on order but only ones I could find for this saw is the original Rockwell blade. One of my buds suggest maybe the blade is too thin causing the drift. I will try it again on smaller job.
reviews.author: ervski

reviews.title: "Doesn't cut a straight line."
reviews.text: I needed a saw a compact corded circular saw like this badly. I regularly cut stacks of plywood board totally about 1" in depth. I was using a cordless saw but I get sick of changing the battery. I use a common pine board as a fence to keep the cut straight. Heres what happens with the rockwell saw when cutting along a fence, it will bind to the point where its impossible to push the saw any further. This happens because the saw blade is too thin. The thin blade will warp and bend shortly into the cut, it walks the saw toward the fence causing a bind. I'm very disappointed. I'm searching for a way around this problem and I shouldn't have to. As much as I hate to admit it I think I'll have to take this saw back to Lowe's. I cant find a thicker blade anywhere. The blade is TOO THIN.
reviews.author: Flewggle

reviews.title: "Good saw - awkward handle"
reviews.text: I've used a worm drive since 1967. I'm no good with a sidewinder, can't see the blade and they bounce too much. Elbow worn out. So I bought this one. It's light and strong but the grip is awkward, especially when set for shallow cuts. I'll use it but less because of the lack of a grip handle. It's cool, it's fun, but could be better.BUT, my big gripe is this, Where in this product description is the warning that no one on earth makes 4 1/2 inch. 3/8th arbor blades except for Rockwell!!!
reviews.author: Raylan

reviews.title: "Excellent little saw!!!"
reviews.text: Bought mine in February and found it to be a perfect tool for the DIY projects I need to do to my RV. Fantastic for plunge cutting, easy to handle and comfortable to use. I love that it can cut up to 2 inches deep and that you can also angle the blade if needed. It's pretty versatile for a compact saw. MY only problem, being a very small female, is that I have to use my left hand to push in the safety button so that I can use it. Not a huge inconvenience given the way this tool performs.
reviews.author: animalangel

reviews.title: "Rockwell tools ROCK!!!"
reviews.text: I own 3 tools from Rockwell and very impressed with the ease and more important their quality. With the asscessories that come with these tools makes it a breeze to complete the DIY projects around the house! I let all my neighbors, friends, and coworkers about them and highly recommend them to get Rockwell products. My next purchase will be the Bladerunner X2 tabletop. Believe me everyone, get their tools and you will see and it doesn't cost an arm and a leg which helps the wallet too!
reviews.author: Sam T

reviews.title: "Killer little saw!!!"
reviews.text: I've been contemplating buying this saw for quite some time. Finally I pulled the trigger. I couldn't be happier! I put it to work immediately. The thin blades blasted through some really heavy wet pressure treated 2x6's with no problem. Love how the blade is on the left side, easier to see what you're doing. The zero mark is spot on. The only thing I don't like is the safety button, kinda awkward, but if that's the only bad thing I can live with that. Keep the awesome tools coming!!! [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.author: Scooter

reviews.title: "The Tool for Cutting Plywood"
reviews.text: This is my favorite power tool. I have been building speaker cabinets, and the Rockwell Compact Circular Saw is significantly easier to use with 1/2" and 3/4" plywood than is a full-size circular saw. The cuts are easy, precise, and with a reasonably fresh blade, surprisingly clean. I'm sure it works well on lumber, too, but especially if you do a lot of plywood and panel work, adding this tool to your shop is a no-brainer. Make yourself a zero-clearance cutting guide and go to town.
reviews.author: Doug

reviews.title: "Awesome.  Great little tool."
reviews.text: I help a neighbor build decks, redo furniture and make shelving.  He had a big circular saw and I decided I wanted this one.  He has about taken it over.  I also have the versa cut by Rockwell but I really wanted one that would actually cut 2 x 4".  That was the first thing I cut with ease.  The different blades makes it a fantastic all use saw.  It is well balanced and easy to hold without any problem.  The power is great for this little baby. Glad I got it and so is my neighbor. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.author: Cheri in Mississippi

reviews.title: "A pleasantly complete package"
reviews.text: I received this saw as a gift, and am pleased with it so far. The saw is powerful and easy to use, and comes with an effective dust port adapter and cutting guide. The included blade cuts framing materials with ease. My only criticism (and why I'm not giving 5 stars) is that it is difficult to tell exactly where the blade is even using the notch/mark at the front. I suspect that with enough practice this will not be an issue, but it would be nice if it was easier to see the blade.
reviews.author: Sameer

reviews.title: "great for DIY projects"
reviews.text: I have purposely stayed away from doing projects that would require big circular saws...not sure why, but they have always made me uncomfortable. When I saw this saw and read it was capable of cutting a 2x4, I knew it was my answer!It works great and I have used it several times now. If there is a real down side is that it doesn't come with a case or bag...and it is too long to use a generic tool bag. I have found it frustrating to not have it in a case to store and to carry.
reviews.author: karen

reviews.title: "Great Saw!"
reviews.text: We purchased this saw because it can do everything that a heavier, larger, circular saw accomplishes.  My Guy loves the light weight and the miter feature.  However, as a gal who would like to be able to use this tool, I cannot because the grip is too large for my hand and fingers.  I can barely get my fingers around the grip and then I cannot depress the start button; very frustrating.  I wish that Rockwell would design tools specifically for women who have smaller hands. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.author: Sogal

reviews.title: "Good for price"
reviews.text: Does what i needed it for. No issues. Cant speak for longevity as ive only had it for a little over a month but works great.
reviews.author: Bobby

reviews.title: "Great Little Saw"
reviews.text: I am an avid woodworker and spend all my free time in my workshop. My wife bought this saw for me last Christmas and after using it I feel I need to leave this review. The saw has a lot of power for a little saw but is hard to keep on line. The dust port works very well but when attached to a vacuum, the hose drags across the project and can block your view. My biggest complain with this saw is the safety button you have to push before the saw will start. I have very large hands but I still can not start this saw with one hand (unless you are left handed). This button need to be repositioned so that a normal person can push the safety button with their thumb while starting the saw. I would buy this again if the button problem is corrected. I am trying to figure out a way to bypass the button or convert it to a switch.
reviews.author: Double_D

reviews.title: "It's a winner with me"
reviews.text: I bought mine about two weeks ago. Recently bought an old, old house that is a fixer upper. I have been putting in some new cabinets and a closet upstairs and this has made it so much easier to get the job done.  Have lots of trim, cabinets and smaller jobs that need to be done right there, instead of running to basement or outside to cut pieces. It is the perfect size for smaller jobs, haven't had any issues with it. In fact I just bought another one to give my son.
reviews.author: Jenm

reviews.title: "Rockwell saw"
reviews.text: This saw is powerful and versatile. Ot adjusts for depth and angle. It gets huge job done.
reviews.author: KH

reviews.title: "Great tool except?"
reviews.text: I've used this tool for the past six months... long enough to realize that whoever designed the placement of the red safety button that must be depressed before the power trigger can be activated was not a serious user of compact circular saws. My whole reason for purchasing this saw was to be able to use it in hard to reach angles/places. My hand size and wrist dexterity is certainly average, but incapable of easily operating the trigger unless I'm standing directly over the saw in the simplest cutting position.I purchased this saw because it was one of the few that had a platform that could be rotated for depth of cut and for angle of cut, and it had plenty of power. It is a great saw for those reasons alone. Don't buy it if you think that it will be easy to use in hard to reach places. Absolutely buy it otherwise.
reviews.author: RobertLJ

reviews.title: "Best tool money I ever spent"
reviews.text: I've owned my saw for over a year and a half. I can't remember when I have used one of three 7.25" saws I own. I always go to my Rockwell. Makes a beautiful rip cut of 2 x 4's, crosscuts, and cuts in plywood/paneling. As with any power tool you need to use it a while to get comfortable with it. While ripping some .75 plywood while working with a couple of co-workers, they both said they were buying a Rockwell. It's simply the best tool purchase I have ever made.
reviews.author: todd

reviews.title: "Best circular saw ever"
reviews.text: I build dollhouses and this little saw is spectacular for plywood of all thicknesses.  Lightweight, straight easy cuts and no splinters or chipping.  The only problem is with the safety button.  If you have small hands like I do, you have to be a contortionist to hold the safety button in while activating the on button.  I solved this problem by putting a small screw in the side of the safety button to hold it in.  Really like Rockwell tools and their quality. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.author: Uncle Bobbys Hobbies

reviews.title: "VERY VERSATILE"
reviews.text: Comes in very handy when you really don't need a larger saw. Light weight and still has enough power. I use it primarily around the house for odd jobs, so most times a battery powered tool is really not necessary. I would have given it 5 stars, but, mine was missing the parallel guide as shown with items that should be included. The other thing that I don't understand is that this is a 4 1/2" saw, but on your web sight you only sell 3 3/8" blades.....Why ???
reviews.author: BULLDOG NICK

reviews.title: "Very good,but could use some improvements"
reviews.text:
I have been working with Circular saw for month. I used it for small cuts and taking out engineered hardwood flooring at 5/8 in. It worked well, but even after tightening the blade, it would manage to come slightly loose after about 1/2 hr. of use. You have to make sure that the blade is tight with the allen wrench periodically. Measurements worked well for adjusting depth.

They could have also given you a bag to store it in. There was none in my box.
reviews.author: murfman

reviews.title: "Finally, after all the years..."
reviews.text: Tool manufacturers are adding nominal-cost features that make operating more pleasurable for example; the power cord is longer than what used to be referred-to as 'industry standard'. Not only that, there is a band of velro attached to the cord making it quik and easy to pack-away at the end of the work-day.Having this light-weight versatile equipment actually makes my day more productive!I still use the heavy 71/4" saw but only for heavy framing jobs.
reviews.author: Notachump

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: leonard

reviews.text: There is no review to accompany this rating.
reviews.author: Pam

reviews.title: "Outstanding customer experience"
reviews.text: While I haven't had the opportunity to try out the saw yet (I will next week), this review is about the experience I had purchasing this saw through Rockwell. As a marketing professional, I have a special appreciation for B2B and B2C e-commerce sites that are well designed, easy to navigate and most importantly, a customer order process that works fast and efficiently.Ordering the saw was easy and it arrived much sooner than expected. After receiving the saw, still researching additional tools I'll need before starting my project next week, I contacted Rockwell to see whether another manufacturer's rip-cut guide would work with this saw. I didn't get the response I hoped for but the response was fast. It's these little things that make for a great customer experience and that will make me think Rockwell first before buying another tool.
reviews.author: ddobski

reviews.title: "Compact and powerful"
reviews.text: I am a home maker and not a experienced handyman. I own the Versa Saw and I use it a lot. I have a lot of tools just because I like owning and learning to use them. This compact circular saw is the just want you need to cut those 2x4's and not have to drag out the old, heavy full size circular saw, which I do own.I saw the infomercial about this tools quite some time ago but put off buying it until I was working on building a shelf and needed to cut some 2x4s. This tool does just what it says it will do. It is powerful and oh so handy. This tool is lighter than a full size saw but it is not lightweight.The Rockwell tools are 5 five for my needs. The only disappointment that I have is that it did not come with a carrying bag. The tool came an attachment and the bag would allow you to store and carry it easily. Now I have to find a bag.
reviews.author: MsCat WV

reviews.title: "Would purchase another"
reviews.text: I would not rate this a 5, but it's not a 4 either. Holding both switches is a bit querky and very difficult to use left handed, sometimes there are cuts where you have to switch hands. I wouldn't call this the most ergonomic tool I've ever owned but it certainly has power and a place in my tool corral. I would like to see a greater selection of blades, especially fine tooth carbide. It would probably suit the one tool novice just fine.
reviews.author: Tony2tools

reviews.title: "Design for someone with 10" hands"
reviews.text: Didn't you test this saw with real carpenters before you released  it? I bought it to use in tight areas in my remodel jobs...My Dremel does not have the power or blade depth... your saw with the safety buttons make it impossible to use... i have to tape the switches! which is even more crazy than cutting, hanging upside down, 12' feet up... idea is great design sucks!  Back to trying to cut a straight line with a sawzall with one hand [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.author: baggs

reviews.title: "Poorly made"
reviews.text: Was impressed when I first purchased this saw. It is small and light weight. After using it, I changed my mind. The locks for angle and depth cuts are poorly designed and come loose very easily. The sliding cutting guide lock bolt will not hold the guide in place. Don't expect a lot of power when cutting either. This saw is for small and light weight jobs only. The real value of this saw is about $39-40, not the $90-100 price.
reviews.author: GJRH

reviews.text: I am a female senior citizen in age but in action much younger. I perform numerous needed tasks in my home. When a tree branch fell I would use my circular saw to cut it up big and bulky but now I can use the Rockwell small circular saw which is not too heavy and very controllable. I also repaired a fence easily. It is a great design and a long time in coming for those of us who are independent and enjoy projects and repairs
reviews.author: Denise

reviews.title: "Great Saw."
reviews.text: I bought this a couple weeks ago. Had a project to put brick molding around my windows. Needed a smaller saw, this saw fit the bill. Small enough to get into tight places, and has the power to do the job. Adjusts easy to different depths and angles just like the bigger ones. The only compaint is that I'm Left handed and the little red button to engage the trigger is annoying, but you get used to it. Great Saw and well built.
reviews.author: BearPaw Dave

reviews.title: "Small but mighty"
reviews.text: I bought this saw to cut framing studs and do general construction work. It I very compact and light weight which allows great handling yet it cuts through material fast. My contractor has been so impressed by this little saw that he now wants one. This is definitely a go to for me. I wish there was a cordless version . I also don't like the placement of the unlock button. It can be awkward to press when doing some cuts.
reviews.author: casarojo40

reviews.title: "Perfect hand held saw"
reviews.text: I was cutting rafter ends with a regular skillsaw trying to hold on with one hand. i bought this saw. and did the same job in less than half the time; very easy to control and the power is endless. The man that was helping me loved the tool so I snuck out and bought him one for his help. He also uses the tool every day. The only thing I would change is the location of the safety button so you could get your thumb on it.
reviews.author: flywheelz

reviews.title: "I like the compact size without giving up power."
reviews.text: I just received mine today and went right down the shop with it to see how well it cut 2/6s. Cut through with no problems. Over all it looks to be a great addition to my shop tools. Now how long it lasts? I don't know yet. Only one thing I don't like about the saw is the lock off button. I have small hands and it's hard to push the lock button and still be able to squeeze the on switch without almost using both hands.
reviews.author: rustynuts

reviews.title: "Poorly designed"
reviews.text: My thumb doesn't reach the safety release button because it is located too far down on the left side. Poorly designed ergonomically. Also, the left side of the shoe needs to be twice as wide. You won't be able to cut as close to a wall, but there is not enough shoe exposed to keep the saw flat on end cuts. Cutting from the left side of a saw horse means the numbers on a tape measure are upside down.
reviews.author: Ken

reviews.title: "Has its uses, but....."
reviews.text: First thing.... I Hate the safety button on trigger.  Then the Shoe Base sides are not parallel to the blade, which makes the parallel guide bar kind of useless.  Blade was not set at 90 degrees to base shoe and could not be set to 90 due to base shoe being poorly made, I had to modify shoe to get it to go to 90 degrees from saw blade and it barely gets there. Quality of shoe base is not there, too flimsy and poorly made, the saw is basically only good for doing a quick cutting of a 2x4 or some thin sheet stock, Rockwell needs to work on this saw's design some more. What happened to quality control checking??? Over all I like the idea behind this design but Rockwell needs to do better at building it. If your looking for a precision tool, this is NOT one by a long way!!  If your just looking for a tool to whack a few 2x4's without pulling out the big heavy guns then this might work.
reviews.author: Dewalt57

reviews.title: "Works like a charm"
reviews.text: Saw works great. Built like a tank. Used it cut about 1/4" thick steel plate. Just a short cut, maybe 2" by 3". My intent is to only do something like this ONCE. Used the diamond tile blade which worked fine as long as I did not push it too hard. I don't really recommend using this on steel but I was too lazy to use a hack saw. I'm sure this will cut wood and drywall like a hot knife through butter.
reviews.author: Toolpal

reviews.title: "A Beautiful And Powerful Saw For It's Size"
reviews.text: I've used a number of hand held electric saws in my time and this one beats them all. When I watched and listened to it do a horizontal cut to replace the defective siding all the way around the house I could hardly believe how superior it was to the old, reliable, cumbersome, 7 1/4 inch saws we all have used. It really is a lightweight performer with a lot of muscle. I'm tickled that I bought it
reviews.author: Lazysb

reviews.text: I am a home builder / contractor for 35yrs .I bought my Rockwell saw a week ago as I needed a smaller saw to cut in tight places where my 7 1/4 worm drive saw is too bulky. I have used the Rockwell saw everyday and have to say it is a great investment and easy to use. I have the same problem as others finding blades for the Rockwell saw.Lowes store did not have a single 4 1/2 blade with the 3/8 arbor as all Lowes had were 4 1/2 in blades with the 5/8 arbor.. Maybe Rockwell could make an adapter ring/insert so a 4 1/2 in blade with 5/8 arbor could be used since they are common in most lumber yards.I really like the Rockwell saw and will have to buy blades online from Rockwell since they are so hard to find..The only down fall is the availability of saw blades for the Rockwell besides that I can't think of anything negative to say about the saw.Great power. easy to use. price is right.
reviews.author: Nailer45

reviews.title: "Excellent small saw"
reviews.text: I make furniture and mainly need to rip plywood up to 3/4 inch and most a 4 by 2. Had tried a couple of other brand cheap circular saws and returned them. Bought this on a special deal at lowes. Only had it less than a week but found it excellent so far. as a "lefty" the safety release on the left is ideal. The vacuum port is great too and helps remove almost all of the dust. Very pleased so far.
reviews.author: SuwaneeGuy

reviews.title: "Not what I needed for my project type"
reviews.text: This was needed to cut a piece of veneer and I asked the sales person on the floor for a blade as well.  This ripped the veneer and later I found out I should have had a blade for cutting a panel, something very smooth.
reviews.author: Bernadette

reviews.title: "What a great saw!"
reviews.text: I bought this saw off the reputation of the smaller Rockwell saw I have. I have not touched my old Craftsman circular saw since I got my first Rockwell. I have been remodeling a bathroom including a new construction of a double shower. I have not needed to touch another saw since I started including the cutting of the concrete backer board. I wouldn't trade my Rockwell saws for anything.
reviews.author: Joeybear1

reviews.title: "NOT for small hands!"
reviews.text: Bought this at Lowes in October "14, and had to return next day. My short fingers made it difficult to press both buttons at the same time. Saw appears to be well built and would have been a good addition to my tools. Did not cut anything because of hand/switch issue, felt I could not get a good enough grip on it even with smaller area around switch. Back to the 6.5 in. trim saw.
reviews.author: btderby

reviews.title: "Powerful Compact"
reviews.text: My wife purchased this for me for Father's Day. She knows how much I dislike my regular size circular saw and thought this would work better for me. She was correct! I like the smaller blade. It is easier to handle. I like the adjustable blade depth & angle. It cut pressure-treated wood for outdoor use with ease. I like how the blade stops when the red button is released.
reviews.author: HomeRepairHubby

reviews.title: "Perfect for me!"
reviews.text: This smaller than a regular circular saw is great for me I can handle it wonderfully for all of what I need it for it's not huge like some of the other ones and is great to take with me. Don't let the smaller size fool you I've had no problems cutting through the things I need to cut through and is lighter so that I have no problem holding for extended periods of time.
reviews.author: teel0

reviews.title: "great Tool"
reviews.text: I liked everything about this tool. Cuts really well with a lot of power for size. The red button that you need to press before you depress the trigger to work the tool was a little awkward to use. I had to work with the tool in both hands and that button only works ok with one hand as opposed to the other. That is something that should be looked at for future models.
reviews.author: rford3678

reviews.title: "Very good buy"
reviews.text: Purchased this saw for our son-in-law for Christmas,also purchased two saws about two or three years ago for me and our son,we both like the versatility of this saw,there is a lot of good features this saw provides,really like the compact size,very good for smaller cutting and can be used for larger jobs,no need to bring out the 7 1/2" saw,I would recommend this saw. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.author: By Bernie

reviews.title: "Must have for any serious DIYer!"
reviews.text: I have this 4 1/2 saw for about 3 years now and cannot be happier. Bought as an alternative to having regular size saw, this little one did all the jobs and I still don't need to buy a big saw. The supplied blade is OK, but I installed Diablo blade which makes cleaner cuts. Rockwell, please don't discontinue this saw since when it breaks, I will buy another one. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.author: geneluciano

reviews.text: i bought this circular saw about 2 weeks ago, received it a 4 day ago. i like it except for the saftey switch is way on the bottom and i have trouble starting it. this saw must of been designed for a person with super large hands. other than that it works nice when it start cutting. if the safty switch was a little higher it would make it an excellent tool.
reviews.author: carlito

reviews.title: "Awesome - Powerful"
reviews.text: Don't let its size fool you. It has the same kickback as a 7-1/2” saw. Cuts thru 2x stock easily. Great for tight spots.  My bigger saws get a lot of rest with this saw. Great for toolboxes too.   The only minor thing I don't like about it, is the trigger permissive button.  It requires a little more thumb flex than I have to depress it to pull the trigger.
reviews.author: Navy Davie

reviews.title: "Handy saw in my shop.."
reviews.text: Just got this saw at Lowes. I did not need another saw as I have several but I can't pass up a good deal. I neede to build another work table in my basement shop so I thought I would give the saw a try. I must tell you I was very impressed with this saw. Fit well in my hand, very light, very accurate and easy to use. Would advise you try it in your shop.
reviews.author: Holie

reviews.title: "Not for me"
reviews.text: I like the idea of having a small saw around the shop so I picked one of these up.First thing I noticed is safety lock switch is not in best position for one hand operation, awkward reaching back with thumb, changing grip position. Also the blade has a tendancy to slip, I was not impressed with the locking method of blade. Won't be using this tool much
reviews.author: Paul58

reviews.title: "won't cut straight"
reviews.text: I have a new one it was great for awhile then started not wanting to cut straight so I put a new blade in, that didn't work. I know it hasn't been dropped. it won't even cut straight even with a guide. I took it back and got a new one same story works great at first then it gets worse as time goes by. I would give this saw a 0 but that is not an option
reviews.author: wood man

reviews.title: "Maybe it's me."
reviews.text: After reading all these 5 star reviews I hate to be different. I bought this saw for one reason - to trim about an inch off of 1x6 porch boards. After being able to cut through two the saw just quit, not running but cutting. Could the blade had dulled out that soon? I couldn't even cut through a small 1x4 piece of wood. Any advice would be appreciated.
reviews.author: Anonymous

reviews.title: "Compact and easy to use"
reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase, compared to a full size circular saw, it works just as well but easier to maneuver and not nearly as heavy. Given it's size you would think your giving up power, not the case, this saw goes right through boards with ease. Great features such as blade depth, angled cuts,and guide included. Will highly recommend to friends!
reviews.author: martyc4

reviews.title: "Bought wrong item"
reviews.text: This saw was recommended by a Lowe's associate to enlarge cracks on my concrete patio for filling.  It was the wrong tool.  Another associate (Louise at Wetumpka) corrected the mistake and fitted me with an angle grinder and proper cutting wheels.  All worked well after I followed her advice.  This saw probably works well if used for intended purpose.
reviews.author: Ken

reviews.title: "Satisfying purchase !"
reviews.text:
I purchased this item on sale for about 65%
of the next lowest price that I could find anywhere .
It arrived by Canada Post amazingly fast , in about 3 days .
The item seems to be extremely well made .
As I do not have a heated workshop
I will not be using this item until this next spring
and I shall comment on the functionality of it then .
reviews.author: jrw57

reviews.title: "worst handle grip"
reviews.text: Didn't even use it once i opened the box. I have large hands and I have to say the grip on this is just poor. Was hoping by me having larger hands that it would suite me just fine. That was not the case. I Couldn't imagine using this in tight places. I will be returning this one. It did seem well built. Maybe their next design will factor this in.
reviews.author: Scrad

reviews.text: It's so easy to use and the Cut is very well, I did cut a very thin long piece about less than 1/4 of an inch from a 2x4x6, just followed the line I drawed that thin piece came out perfectly. I use the 7 in. Circular saw all the time, it's so heavy and hard to control. This is a very light weight and easy to carry to anywhere around the house. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.author: Homer

reviews.title: "Nice little saw."
reviews.text: I've spent nearly 50 yrs using the 7 1/2 " Circular Saws and even the worm drive until I couldn't lift any more. I have built homes from ground to roofing and even finish, and cabinets. I like this 4 12" saw for it's weight, compactness, ease of use, and precision. It took a little time to adjust but this will be great for my cabinet shop.
reviews.author: benz shop

reviews.title: "Very easy to use and cuts great."
reviews.text: I bought this about 4 or 5 months ago and had to replace some siding on my house and this was a much better saw then a big 8 or 9 inch saw to use up on the roof side.  I was trimming some of the siding and cutting 1/8 in off and worked just fine.  Glad I got it.  Told one of my daughters and she got one for her husband for Christmas 2016.
reviews.author: Jerry from VA

reviews.title: "Ease Of Use"
reviews.text: I am Senior Female, remodeling daughters house, and this saw is awesome! I bought my saw about 10 months ago, it is light weight, easy to use, cuts anything I would use a circle saw on, and everyone who has tried it, loved it. I just purchased two more for gifts, so mine is not on loan when I need it. Another Great Rockwell tool!!!
reviews.author: Alice

reviews.title: "Packs a wallop."
reviews.text: I bought this saw at Menard's about 2 weeks ago and used it for the first time on a job last night. Cut through 1/2 plywood like a hot knife through butter. Very easy to handle and to cut a straight line. Red safety switch could be a little bigger. Overall, I am glad I bought it. It will be used in my carpentry/remodeling business.
reviews.author: oldguy64

reviews.title: "Solid saw!"
reviews.text: I bought this "compact" circular saw, with the intent of ending my frustration when my saber saw blade wouldn't give me a square, 90 degree cross cut while moving through a knot on the board. This Rockwell compact circular saw has been awesome, and I'm VERY SATISFIED with it's power. Thanks again for providing this "compact" tool.
reviews.author: Blaine

reviews.title: "very strong saw"
reviews.text: Used saw to cut through ceramic tile on top of 1" of cement mud floor with dimond blade and it did so whithout even any effort. Main purpose was to have a trim saw that can hadle going through 2x material in a single pass. The only thing that they may have changed was the safty button placement but it is not a deal breaker.
reviews.author: edfirn

reviews.title: "Too early to tell"
reviews.text:
Bought this to replace older circular saw.
Like the idea of a smaller saw which I presumed would be lighter to handle.
This is in part true but not as light as I would have expected. It also takes a larger hand than mine to handle and use effectively.
Have made a few test cuts with the saw and it seems to do the job.
reviews.author: Toronto416

reviews.title: "Good features - unable to purchase blades (RW8684)"
reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas and he was excited about using this new tool. He planned on using this for a tile project in our MBR bath but we were unable to find the blades. With that being said the tool is pretty much worthless! We have not been able to find the blades anyplace not even on line RW8684. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.author: Texans Fan

reviews.title: "Straight Line cut, not"
reviews.text: I have had this saw for over a year. I also have the smaller Rockwell saw and it works great. The problem with this saw is that it will not cut a straight line for some reason. It will  not follow a straight line on the fence and even watching the blade directly. I wonder if the blade warps as it gets warm or hot.
reviews.author: Byron

reviews.title: "Works great: powerful motor"
reviews.text: I bought this some time ago and it has performed flawlessly.  I only have one slightly negative thing to say:  the safety switch is hard to deal with when pulling the trigger.  If the switch had been mounted on top or bottom activating the saw would be easier.  This is why I checked "good, good" on the ratings.
reviews.author: Elton

reviews.title: "rk 3441 Nice"
reviews.text: Good small circular saw that will cut 2x 4's with ease while allowing good up to 45 degree angle cuts . Good ergonomic design makes using saw easy. The location of the safety button on the left side of product is only annoying aspect iI found. Good product now made by Worcx using the older Rockwell Brand name.
reviews.author: Budster 1

reviews.title: "Perfect size."
reviews.text: I do scrollwork and need small backerboards for the fretwork.  Put larger sheet stock in my jawhose then cut it down to manageable size.  Don't need that bulky circular saw.  The only drawback is the safety button which must be pushed before the switch is activated.  Wish it was in a more practical location.
reviews.author: patom

reviews.title: "Perfect for most cuts"
reviews.text: Great for most jobs but really excels for me being lightweight.  As a woman, getting older and not near as strong with some arthritis, this tool makes all the difference.  Safer too because I have better control because of the light weight.  Donʻt have to lug out the full size circular saw for much anymore.
reviews.author: MaukaJo

reviews.title: "Handy portable size"
reviews.text: I bought this saw as an addition to my circular saw. It is a great size and more powerful than I thought. The con about this product is the grip. It is too big to wrap my hand around it while pushing the safety button and trigger to turn the saw on. Huge problem. I have to use both hands to turn the saw on.
reviews.author: jaymack

reviews.title: "poor design"
reviews.text: The safety button on the  left side is too far down to reach with your right hand while using the off/ on switch. This requires you to hold that button in with your left hand and squeeze the  start trigger with your right. Dangerous! The saw should also have a handle or grip on the front for better control.
reviews.author: Harold 78

reviews.title: "Great little saw"
reviews.text: I think if you have reasonable expectations of what you can do with this compact circular saw you will be satisfied.  Seems to be pretty well made and did what i asked of it i.e. cutting plywood, pegboard, etc.  Haven't cut any 2x yet.  Sure like the blade being on the left for ease of following cut line.
reviews.author: C

reviews.title: "Best Mini saw Built To Date!"
reviews.text: I have been using this for about a year now and could not ask for a better tool to cut in tight spaces and works wonders for doing delicate brick work, I'm not a professional but I love doing things myself and have found that this tool makes my off the wall projects a whole lot easier. Thanks Rockwell...
reviews.author: RebelG

reviews.title: "works as advertised"
reviews.text: I am a woodworker and have built furniture and homes as well. I have a couple of 7 1/2 saws a table saw and jig saws. I bought this because I liked the dust pick up feature. The first time I used it I cut through a dense 2X4 with no problems and NO DUST !!!. Use it as intended and it will serve you well.
reviews.author: CRAFTY

reviews.title: "Great one handed saw"
reviews.text: I bought this saw a little over a month ago, and have left my larger circular saw in my tool box. The ease of using this saw with one hand, making my cuts with my carpenter square is a breeze, use it for cutting my 2x4 to 2x12, take my time for a straight clean cut, goes through 1x4 and up with no issue.
reviews.author: Big J

reviews.title: "Outstanding Products"
reviews.text: This is the third rockwell product I have purchased over the last two years. They all have be unreal but the last purchase was this hand held saw. This thing cuts like butter through wood and more. I wish I had this last year when we had a big project going on.. Thanks again for your great tools.. Keith
reviews.author: keb64

reviews.title: "Easy to use"
reviews.text: I bought mine last December and have not used my 7 1/4 saw sense. Even though it has pro. quality it is a safer saw to use for new users. In my area the saw is only sold in one store that I have found and only at holiday time. I will buy a spare next time I find one to be sure I will always have one.
reviews.author: Glenn

reviews.text: I purchased this saw a couple of weeks ago due to the fact I was extremely satisfied with the versa-cut saw I purchased over 1.5 years ago. If I had know that the 4.5 inch saw was available I would have bought it then. Both saws are easy to handle and are excellent for the work I do. Thank You!
reviews.author: High roller the second

reviews.title: "Kicks Butt"
reviews.text: A friend of mine raved about this saw and loaned it to me for some remodel work. This thing cut through 2x4 as if they were match sticks. It's light, easy to maneuver, and I may never use my full size circular saw again. Needless to say, I ordered my own saw after returning the one I borrowed. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.author: Samtheman

reviews.title: "big power in compact saw"
reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. small enough to carry around no problem and power of a big saw. I use my in tight places where you could not put a bigger saw, and the adjustment, very easy to set. comes with a nice little guide. I am very happy with this saw I guarantee you will be too.
reviews.author: pumpkinworm

reviews.title: "Excellent service!"
reviews.text: I've always respected Rockwell tools, and my new purchase is all I hoped for. Great tool, very practical. Your customer service was excellent, order arrived promptly and in fine condition. You could have used a smaller shipping box. It was three times the size of the tool package enclosed.
reviews.author: Cricket

reviews.title: "great cuts but not for lefthanders"
reviews.text: I have used several times now on small repairs, cuts straight and clean. 2x6 wasn't a problem. Opened a porch floor without an issue. The negatives for me was the safety button on the left wasn't easy to reach and the other was being a lefty it was a little harder than a full size to use.
reviews.author: retiredcop

reviews.title: "Great Compact Versatile Saw"
reviews.text: Recently purchased this tool for a project in the attic.  There's not much room in the attic and I was tired of lugging around a heavy 7 1/4 inch saw.  This lightweight gem was just what I needed.  The laser guide works well, has plenty of power and the kit came with five extra blades. [This review was collected as part of a promotion.]
reviews.author: HT460

reviews.title: "Great saw!"
reviews.text: Had considered panel saw for wood shop to cut 3/4 playwood panels. Full sheet were killing me getting them up to the table saw to cut. Now I just flip panel up on saw horses and use edge guide. Now I can cut pretty darn straight panels without wrestling them up on the table. Love it!

It flies forward as fast as you push it and leaves very clean, almost polished cuts. I was really impressed.Noise isn't bad and even less than other circular saws. The balance of the tool is very nice and feels natural in the hand. Blade change is easy and raising the guard to start certain cuts is easy and feels safe. The saw also offers a good two handed grip - how I recommend it be used though it runs one-handed well.The only con as I see it is the safety. reviews.text: I have had this saw for a couple of weeks now and have had the pleasure of its use for cutting both wood and plastic. The power is amazing, even cutting 2x4's. The saw kerf is narrow so the saw cuts with very little effort. I just finished a project involving 1" thick HDPE and the vacuum attachment really came in handy. Attached to my shop vac, the saw made almost no mess at all when cutting the 1" polyethylene. The cuts were so smooth that no sanding was required. The saw is easy to handle and has already become my portable circular saw of choice for most projects. When considering this saw, I also thought about the smaller Versacut saw but opted for the compact circular saw instead because of the increased depth capacity. It would be nice if Rockwell included a carrying case for the saw, rip guide, and extra blades like they did for the Versacut. I bought a military tool bag (19"x9"x6") with zipper closure that works well, however. In summary, the Rockwell Compact Circular Saw is a well made tool that can stand up to a lot of use even when cutting material approaching its maximum depth. You can't go wrong with the quality of Rockwell Tools!

One thing I did notice was that my hands are not large so I had to remember to use my longest finger to wrap around the saw for one-hand operation. reviews.title: "Mediocre"
reviews.text:
Rockwell's Compact Circular Saw has its pluses & minuses. It has a nice long electrical cord; I have used it many times without using an extension cord. The depth and angle adjustment are simple and easy to use. When holding the Compact Circular Saw, it seems heavy for its size and solidly build; that being said, when I turn off my saw, as it is spinning down, it makes loud and disturbing noises, like metal clanging or bearings flying around inside the motor. However, it continues to work and works well. (I will keep using it until it flies apart.) 
On the minus side, how cheap can Rockwell be; for a hundred dollars, they give you a cardboard box to store your Compact Circular Saw. 
The thing I dislike most about the Compact Circular Saw is the safety/on-off switch. My hand is of average to large size. I have found it difficult to turn on the Compact Circular Saw on while wearing leather gloves; it is hard to grip and turn on the safety switch. I can manage without gloves but I rather wear gloves while the saw blade is spinning. 
The Compact Circular Saw has its place but it is no replacement for a 7 ¼ inch saw. I own both the Rockwell Jaw Horse and the Rockwell Oscillating Multi Tool each of which I would rate five stars. However, the Compact Circular Saw is just mediocre, deserving a three or at best a four star rating.

reviews.title: "It's a worthwhile tool to own."
reviews.text:
I don't like to review tools too early in the usage cycle since I can't really comment on durability over time since I've only owned it for a little while. I'll leave that to others who have used one for years. I think the 'bottom line' question for a lot of people is "should I buy one of those little handheld circular saws when I already have a big one". Depending on the work you're doing, the answer may be a strong yes. This tool does not replace a chop saw or a larger circular saw and nobody is suggesting that. If you need to make a lot of production cuts or you need to cut heavier material, those tools have earned their place in the lineup. 

Where this tool shines brightest is when you need to make a field cut in some kind of odd position that requires the smaller, one-handed design. In our case, our home was impacted by Hurricane Matthew and invited in the Atlantic Ocean for a couple hours. The result  was short of a total gut rehab but it was a fairly major renovation that required a lot of retrofitting, of cutting out 'bad' material to be replaced by new, etc, all of it in weird positions. This was purchased later into the project, I wish I had purchased it earlier. It was very helpful, not to mention that as the project progressed, it became the handy grab-and-go saw for making quick cuts on all sorts of stuff, from plywood to trim. 

I give this 4 stars of 5 because I can't attest to its long term durability but presuming this tool holds up, it's a 5 star unit. On a home building or major renovation project, I wouldn't be without a chop saw, I wouldn't be without a full size circular saw and now that I've used this, I wouldn't be without one of these, either.
